keyPolicies.policyDescription: £10/hour minimum wage. Protect pensions with the triple lock.
Build a strong trading country. A Brexit that works for Britain: No to 'Hard Brexit'.
Build more than a million new homes. This will include 500,000 council homes and housing association homes.
Stop the latest plans to destroy our NHS. Integrate social care and health care.
Invest in children with a new National Education Service. Fund, not cut, comprehensive education for all.

mentions.tacticalSituation: The election is so close, Labour can win in Kemptown and Peacehaven. We were just 690 votes short last time so every vote will count. Lloyd is a councillor in our area and is active in the community.

issues.brexitEurope: A Brexit that works for Britain: No to 'Hard Brexit'.
issues.economy: £10/hour minimum wage. Protect pensions with the triple lock.
issues.education: Every school in our area is facing cuts with up to £225k cut from each primary and £0.6 million from each secondary. Labour will introduce a National Education Service and make sure big corporations pay to fund our children's future.
issues.health: Our nation's most prized institution is being dismantled. The Royal Sussex is in 'special measures' and doctors' surgeries from Foxhill (Peacehaven) to Eaton Place (Kemptown) have closed.
issues.socialWelfare: Protect pensions with the triple lock.

housing.content: Build more than a million new homes, including 500,000 council homes and housing association homes.

leaflet.personalStatement: I was born in Brighton, live in Kemptown, had my first job in Peacehaven and currently I am a councillor here. I'm standing to fight for our area. For more homes, for our schools and hospitals, for a better Britain. For the many, not the few.

endorsements.endorsement: As a mother of two young children, I'm against school cuts and the lack of doctors' places. I know only Lloyd will speak up for us in Peacehaven and the whole of Kemptown.
